chapter.title: Installation on Hardware Not Supported at Release

abstract.para: With some newer hardware, the installation medium of &productname; can not boot. This can be the case when the hardware did not exist at the time of the release of &productname;. For such a situation &suse; provides Kernel Update ISO (kISO) images. This chapter describes how to use the Kernel Update to install &productname; on current hardware.

sect1.title: Download Kernel Update
sect1.para: You can download the full ISO image or only the initrd and linux files. The ISO usually needs to be burned to a CD or DVD. The initrd and linux files can be used for a PXE boot. For details about booting via PXE, see .

sect1.title: Boot Kernel Update
sect1.para: To use the Kernel Update, boot from the DVD or via PXE. As soon as the linux and the initrd are loaded, you will be asked to insert the installation DVD.
You can use the boot parameters described in . This allows using other installation sources than the installation DVD.
